How does the Verus DeFi protocol ensure smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities, and what features does it offer for launching new blockchains and liquidity pools?

The Verus DeFi protocol is designed to provide a robust and efficient decentralized finance (DeFi) system that integrates seamlessly with the Verus blockchain ecosystem. To achieve this, the protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, which can lead to unfair advantages and market manipulation.

The Verus DeFi protocol also provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring that the consensus operation runs smoothly and that fee conversion capabilities are enabled. This is achieved by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.

One of the key features of the Verus DeFi protocol is its ability to launch new blockchains and liquidity pools simultaneously. This allows for the creation of a new blockchain with its own decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool, which can operate independently of the Verus blockchain. The bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain.

The Verus DeFi protocol also offers a range of features for crowdfunding currency launches, including minimum participation or automatic refunds, as well as dual launches (blockchain and bridge). This allows users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain, and if the minimums are not met, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, less the network fees. Additionally, the launch options provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, and price-neutral carve-outs.

 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
